info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 19 at 8:10PM EDT until July 19 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Maryland, including the following counties, Anne Arundel, Montgomery and Prince Georges.
* WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bowie... Olney... Crofton... Beltsville... Largo... Bladensburg... Fedex Field... Aspen Hill... Odenton... Laurel... Fairland... Landover... Colesville... Kettering... Mitchellville... Lake Arbor... Cheverly... Woodmore... Lanham-Seabrook... Greater Landover... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING

area.areaDesc: Anne Arundel, MD; Montgomery, MD; Prince Georges, MD
